intro: Amorphophallus konkanensis var. konkanensis, commonly known as the Konkan arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It is characterized by its large,戟-shaped (spear-like) leaves and a distinctive, spadix-shaped inflorescence. The plant produces a tuberous root system that is used as a starch source. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
